12:45.race_name: Virgin Bet EBF "National Hunt" Maiden Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Point winner; only 8th in a bumper but very stoutly bred; can improve now sent further
runners.name: Agent Argylle
runners.spotlight: Bought for £46,000 after winning a good-ground Irish point in May; beaten about 8l in a Wetherby bumper (soft) but showed promise and he's very stoutly bred, so going up in distance for this hurdling debut should benefit.

runners.comment: Second bumper run was better but he wouldn't be the obvious answer on this hurdling debut
runners.name: Berks And Bucks
runners.spotlight: Flat bred; tailed off when only 4-1 for his first bumper but showed more at Warwick (2m, good to soft), finishing a 16l seventh of the 12 runners; wouldn't be the obvious answer on his hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Bumper promise but comfortably held in last two races, the latest his hurdling debut
runners.name: Danger Nap
runners.spotlight: Second on bumper debut and then beaten only 6l in a Listed event; comfortably held in his last two races, the latest his hurdling debut at Aintree (2m4f, good to soft; 22-1).

runners.comment: Unlikely at this best last time at Ascot and stable has won this race twice in three years
runners.name: Dig Deep
runners.spotlight: Close up at Ffos Las (2m4f) and Warwick (2m5f; again on soft) before weakening into sixth at Ascot where he was some way behind West Hill Verde; perhaps wasn't at his best that day (went off only 9-2) and his yard has won this maiden twice in three years.

runners.comment: Has shown he's up to winning a race of this nature and looks sure to keep improving
runners.name: Hardly Surprising
runners.spotlight: Owned by JP McManus when winning his Irish point; badly hampered on his hurdling debut and didn't get the best of runs when only a length away at Bangor (2m3f, soft); has shown he's up to winning a race of this nature and looks sure to keep improving.

runners.comment: Beaten 27l and 47l in first two starts over hurdles; returns from wind surgery
runners.name: Kastellion
runners.spotlight: Second in an Irish point; beaten 27l and 47l in first two starts over hurdles (similar trips to today's) and now returns from wind surgery; best watched.

runners.comment: Kelso bumper winner; positives to take from both runs over hurdles; each-way claims
runners.name: Kiwi Rush
runners.spotlight: Kelso bumper winner; positives to take from both runs over hurdles and he stumbled badly three out when beaten 15l at Cheltenham the last time (2m4f, good; perhaps better on softer); each-way claims.

runners.comment: 33-1 when pulled up at Ascot in the maiden in which West Hill Verde finished third
runners.name: Less Destiny Star
runners.spotlight: Won his bumper here on good ground; limitations exposed in the meantime and was 33-1 when pulled up at Ascot in the maiden in which West Hill Verde finished third and stablemate Dig Deep sixth.

runners.comment: Point form reads really well and ran okay in two small-field bumpers; off since April 24
runners.name: Mulinas
runners.spotlight: Bought for £170,000 after beating the high-class Potters Charm in an Irish point; ran okay in two small-field bumpers in early 2024 (heavy/soft) and Paul Nicholls retained him for £50,000 at the dispersal sale of his previous owner; has been a long-time absent but open to significant improvement; hood added.

runners.comment: In the process of showing improved form when departing late on over C&D last month
runners.name: Name Me Nicely
runners.spotlight: In the process of showing improved form when departing late on over C&D last month and that's something to build on; does have to step up plenty, however.

runners.comment: Ability in Ireland but needs to step up loads on last month's stable/hurdle debut
runners.name: Passing Diamond
runners.spotlight: Won two Irish points and shaped okay in two bumpers as well; however, he was soundly beaten on last month's stable/hurdle debut and needs to leave that run a long way behind.

runners.comment: Point/bumper winner; beaten a long way into third on his hurdling debut at Fontwell
runners.name: Rathkenny
runners.spotlight: Point/bumper winner, latterly on heavy ground; it was good to soft when a remote third in a small field on hurdling debut at Fontwell and perhaps he needs the mud; others preferred on this occasion.

runners.comment: Finished tailed off in a Hereford bumper on debut and that was over a year ago
runners.name: Scrumpyjack
runners.spotlight: Bred to win races but finished tailed off in a Hereford bumper on debut and that was over a year ago.

runners.comment: A good looker who is progressing well; sets the standard on latest third at Ascot
runners.name: West Hill Verde
runners.spotlight: A good looker who is progressing well, having shaped encouragingly in two Newbury maidens (2m) before finishing third at Ascot in a race that's working out nicely (2m5f, soft); sets the standard.

runners.comment: Insufficient promise in two Warwick bumpers to seriously consider for this hurdling debut
runners.name: Tierbay
runners.spotlight: Insufficient promise in two Warwick bumpers to seriously consider for this hurdling debut.

13:15.race_name: Virgin Bet Daily Extra Places "Chasing Excellence" Novices' Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Something to find in today's company but 1-1 over fences and may well have more to offer
runners.name: Lario
runners.spotlight: Useful hurdler who is 1-1 over fences having won a four-runner beginners' chase at Haydock (2m4f, soft) on last month's reappearance; today's task is tougher and he has something to find, but he's unexposed over fences and at this sort of trip, and he may well have more to offer.

runners.comment: Strong form on first two chase starts; drops back in trip but still a leading contender
runners.name: One Big Bang
runners.spotlight: Talented staying hurdler who was a good Listed second on his chase debut at Cheltenham (3m1f, soft) in November, and readily beat a useful rival in a match at Southwell (3m, good to soft) last month; drops back in trip today but there can be optimism he'll cope and he's a leading contender.

runners.comment: Won at Haydock on second chase start and open to further improvement; could have a big say
runners.name: Western Knight
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in Grade 2 novice hurdle last season and he left his chase debut well behind to win a three-runner beginners' chase at Haydock (2m5f, good to soft) last month; open to further improvement and could have a big say in a first-time tongue-tie; showed promise on soft ground in a bumper.

runners.comment: Two-time hurdle winner but others have stronger form and he was pulled up on chase debut
runners.name: Elysian Knight
runners.spotlight: Won two novice hurdles last season (2m4f/2m5f, soft/good); however, others in this field have stronger form and he didn't jump well when pulled up on last month's chase/seasonal debut at Chepstow (2m7f, good to soft).

runners.comment: Chase debut; won maiden hurdle; didn't progress in that sphere; lots of improvement needed
runners.name: Kap Ouest
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo who won a 2m maiden hurdle at Exeter in December 2024; however, he failed to progress subsequently and considerable improvement is needed on this chase debut, following some time off.

runners.comment: Point and Grade 2 novice hurdle winner; out of form when last seen but retains potential
runners.name: Roadlesstravelled
runners.spotlight: Made it 3-3 over hurdles when landing Grade 2 at Haydock (1m7f, soft) in November 2024; pulled up on next two starts and absent since last March, but a break may have helped this point winner who could relish the switch to fences and retains potential; interesting.

13:45.race_name: Virgin Bet A Good Bet Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Defied mammoth absence to win at Southwell; likeable prospect if things keep going to plan
runners.name: Irandando Has
runners.owner: The Late John Hales And Miss L Hales
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut in Listed 3yo hurdle in France (2m2f, very soft) in 2022 and returned from mammoth absence to win at 25-1 at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month on first run for Sam Allwood; he's a likeable prospect, provided things keeping going to plan; respected under a 6lb penalty.

runners.comment: Bumper winner who followed up on hurdle/stable debut at Uttoxeter; strong claims
runners.name: Minella Jury
runners.spotlight: Won a bumper at Wexford (2m, yielding) in October on final run for John Nallen and followed up on his hurdle/stable debut at Uttoxeter (2m, heavy) last month, defying a final-flight stumble; strong claims under penalty.

runners.comment: Useful Flat performer who got off the mark over hurdles at the third attempt at Wetherby
runners.name: Minstrel Knight
runners.spotlight: Useful Flat performer who got off the mark over hurdles at the third attempt at Wetherby (2m, soft) four weeks ago; he's open to further improvement in this code and could have a big part to play under a penalty.

runners.comment: Talented on the Flat; open to improvement on second hurdle start but it's necessary
runners.name: Chillingham
runners.spotlight: Talented on the Flat and open to improvement on second hurdle start; however, he was about 14l behind Minstrel Knight when sixth at Wetherby (2m, soft) last month and may be of greater interest when back in headgear.

runners.comment: Beaten 7l when third of eight on debut in Irish maiden point; others are more compelling
runners.name: Desertmore News
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to 2m6f chase winner O Mio Babbino (RPR 98); dam 2m3f-2m4f hurdle winner (114); beaten 7l when third of eight on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, yielding) in November; others are more compelling.

runners.comment: Wind op since bumper debut but was tailed off and a transformation is needed
runners.name: Hobnail
runners.spotlight: His dam was useful and he's had wind surgery since last month's debut in a bumper at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft); however, he was tailed off at 66-1 and a transformation is needed.

runners.breeder: E A R L Les Obeaux DAnjou Et Al
runners.comment: Runner-up in a point and on hurdle debut, and perhaps heavy ground was too much last time
runners.name: Lasko Des Obeaux
runners.spotlight: Point runner-up (3m, yielding to soft) who filled the same position on hurdle debut at Chepstow (2m, soft) in November; perhaps heavy ground was too much when below par at Exeter (2m) since and he's one to consider.

runners.comment: Bumper winner who was a clear second at Newbury last month and leading claims on that form
runners.name: Legal Weapon
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner (2m, good to soft) who tapped back into that promise when runner-up at Newbury (2m, good to soft) last month on his third hurdle start, coming clear with the winner; unproven on soft ground; leading claims if backing up that latest performance.

runners.comment: Useful on the Flat and promising third to Minstrel Knight at Wetherby; possible player
runners.name: Liberty Coach
runners.spotlight: Useful, four-time Flat winner who made eyecatching late headway into third at Wetherby (2m, soft) last month on his second hurdle start, beaten about 6l by Minstrel Knight who now carries a 6lb penalty; open to further improvement in this code and he's one to be interested in.

runners.breeder: Mrs J A Niven & Mrs Diana Ewart
runners.comment: Possible improver on hurdle debut but others have more substance to their claims
runners.name: Prince Of Clova
runners.owner: Clova Farms And P D Niven
runners.spotlight: From a family his trainer has done well with and he showed ability when fifth of six at 13-2 on debut in a bumper at Newcastle in October (2m1f, good; failed to settle); possible improver on this first start over hurdles but others have more substance to their claims.

runners.comment: Bumper runner-up but struggled in summer 2024 on both hurdle starts; returns from absence
runners.name: Final Escape
runners.spotlight: Runner on debut in Irish bumper in September 2023 but struggling with her jumping when pulled up/well beaten in summer 2024 on her two hurdle starts; this is her first outing since and a watching brief is advised.

runners.comment: Hasn't shown enough to suggest she'll be posing a serious threat today
runners.name: Neeps And Tatties
runners.owner: Dalziel Family K Rogers D Vowles
runners.spotlight: Displayed some ability in bumper/hurdle debut but not enough to suggest she'll pose a serious threat, and she was well beaten last time.

runners.comment: 4yo; progressive at ordinary level on the Flat; improvement needed on fourth hurdle start
runners.name: Division Day
runners.spotlight: 4yo who was progressive at an ordinary level on the Flat in autumn; took a step forward when fourth at Wetherby (2m, soft) last month on third hurdle start but beaten 18l and needs another chunk of improvement.

14:15.race_name: Virgin Bet Supports Safe Gambling Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 11yo who won on reappearance at Uttoxeter in October but pulled up at Newbury next time
runners.name: Dargiannini
runners.spotlight: 11yo who won on reappearance at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good) in October and was pulled up at Newbury (2m4f) in November on a rare encounter with soft ground; this is a less competitive race than last time and he's not written off, but others arrive with less to prove.

runners.comment: Placed on both starts this season; trainer won this last year and he's a major player
runners.name: Guard Duty
runners.spotlight: Progressive last season and has continued the good work this term, finishing second of 15 at Newbury (2m4f, soft) then third of 12 at Windsor (2m4f, good); trainer won this last year and he's a major player.

runners.comment: Arrives in good heart; stamina to prove now back up in trip but he's not ruled out
runners.name: Bowmore
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who was a convincing winner under Daire McConville at Newbury (2m, good to soft) in November before 11l third off this 10lb higher mark behind two well-handicapped rivals here (2m, good to soft); stamina to prove now back up in trip but he's not ruled out.

runners.comment: In the form of his life last March-June but returns from some time off this afternoon
runners.name: Fingals Hill
runners.spotlight: 10yo who was in the form of his life last March-June, with three 2m4f wins (good/good to soft); has also won on soft and over C&D; in the mix if at the top of his game after some time off, but that's the big question.

runners.comment: Disappointing last time but this 6yo is 4-8 over hurdles and remains of interest
runners.name: Glynn Brae
runners.spotlight: Three novice hurdle wins last season (heavy/soft) and he reappeared with a handicap win at Sandown (2m4f, good to soft) in November; disappointing there subsequently (2m, soft) but this lightly raced 6yo remains of interest in view of his previous promise.

runners.comment: Returned from long absence with encouraging run at Haydock and he likes it here
runners.name: Geromino
runners.spotlight: 10yo who returned from a long absence with a pretty encouraging fourth at Haydock last month; he's well treated on his old form and his form figures at Doncaster read 211, including a win in this in 2024; possible player.

runners.comment: 10yo; hasn't been at the top of his game this season but not discounted off dangerous mark
runners.name: Ginger Mail
runners.owner: Mrs David Coltman & Mrs J Douglas Miller
runners.spotlight: 10yo who hasn't been at the top of his game on either run this season; however, this course winner has dropped to a dangerous mark, now 1lb lower than when wining at Ayr (2m4f, soft) last January, and is not discounted.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 6yo who was back on song when runner-up at Musselburgh on New Year's Day
runners.name: Smokeringinthedark
runners.spotlight: Things have been up and down since he won on his rules debut at Musselburgh (2m4f, good to soft) in December 2024 but this lightly raced 6yo was back on song when runner-up there (2m4f, good to soft) three weeks ago; could be in the shake-up if conditions aren't an issue (unproven on soft).

14:50.race_name: Virgin Bet Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Comfortable wins at Hereford on last two starts and she's 7lb ahead of the handicapper
runners.name: Jamaicaine
runners.spotlight: Well backed when getting off the mark at Hereford (2m3f, good to soft) in December and again did it comfortably when defying a 10lb rise to follow up there (2m3f, soft) 11 days ago; under a 7lb penalty she's 7lb ahead of the handicapper and could take all the beating.

runners.comment: Bumper winner who is 0-16 over h'dles but has often been placed; each-way claims once more
runners.name: Vanilla Dancer
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who is 0-16 over hurdles but she's often been placed, which was again the case at Catterick (2m3f, good to soft) last month following wind surgery; also effective on soft; holds each-way claims once more.

runners.comment: She's 8lb lower than when winning at Huntingdon last May but has struggled subsequently
runners.name: Little Soiree
runners.spotlight: She's 8lb lower than when winning for Chris Gordon at Huntingdon last May but was tailed off on her final start for that yard and she's also been a long way below her best on her five outings for this stable.

runners.comment: Got off the mark at Catterick last month, making all by 4l; respected up 7lb
runners.name: Somebodycomegether
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on the Flat and over hurdles in the autumn (including on soft ground) before getting off the mark at the 19th attempt (her sixth run over hurdles) at Catterick (2m3f, good to soft) last month; made all by 4l under Aaron Anderson and she's respected up 7lb.

runners.comment: Below par this term and 0-15 over hurdles, but well handicapped on last season's best form
runners.name: Anamanda
runners.spotlight: Three-time French Flat winner who is 0-15 over hurdles having been below par on her three outings this term; however, she's well handicapped on last season's best efforts and is not written off.

runners.comment: Inconsistent maiden who has been unable to threaten across first three British starts
runners.name: Keep It Cool
runners.spotlight: Finished third of 16 in September on her final Irish start but this inconsistent maiden has been unable to threaten across her first three British starts and needs to raise her game.

runners.comment: Hasn't built on bumper promise since tackling hurdles and soundly beaten in both handicaps
runners.name: Snapaudaciaheros
runners.spotlight: Finished in the frame in all three bumpers but hasn't built on that promise over hurdles, and she's been soundly beaten in both handicaps.

runners.comment: Won on the Flat in October and continued in good heart over hurdles; each-way claims
runners.name: Lillistar
runners.spotlight: 0-11 over hurdles but won on the Flat in October (2m, AW) and continued in good heart in this code, finishing second of six at Musselburgh (2m4f, soft) last month; first-flight faller at Wetherby since; each-way claims.

runners.comment: Heavy ground may have been too much last time, but patchy profile and others are preferred
runners.name: The Last Drop
runners.spotlight: Bumper runner-up who has run the odd reasonable race over hurdles and heavy ground may have been too much at Uttoxeter last time; however, her profile is patchy and others have more substance to their claims.

runners.breeder: Mrs D W Davenport & Mr D Obank
runners.comment: Kept on for 11l third at Newcastle last time and the step up in trip looks a good move
runners.name: Joto
runners.spotlight: 0-8 and yet to pose a serious threat but has hinted at promise in two of her three handicaps, most recently keeping on for 11l third at Newcastle (2m1f, good to soft); the step up in trip looks a good move; could go well.

runners.comment: Not easy to make a case for but she might be able to take a step forward now up in trip
runners.name: Genies Girl
runners.spotlight: Not easy to make a case for but she didn't run badly when fourth on handicap debut at Wetherby (2m, good) last March and may have needed the run on her reappearance there (2m, soft) last month; there's stamina in her pedigree and she might be able to take a step forward now up in trip.

runners.comment: Tailed on AW in November following an absence and is probably best watched
runners.name: Rhyme Scheme
runners.owner: M SimmonsS Woodcock And Miss Ld Sanders
runners.spotlight: Her two Flat wins came in 2021 and she's 0-15 over hurdles; tailed on AW in November following an absence and is probably best watched.

15:25.race_name: Virgin Bet Handicap Chase (Go North Red Rum Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Possible excuses last twice but has a bit to prove in his current form; blinkers return
runners.name: Finn Lough
runners.spotlight: Stays further than this but has a bit to prove in his current form, for all that 3m6f perhaps stretched him two runs back and he met with interference last time; the return of blinkers (replacing cheekpieces) may help as he was second when tried in these aids previously.

runners.breeder: Joel Denis Clotilde De Barmon Emmanuel
runners.comment: First and third in two 2m4f chases and gives the impression he'll stay this trip
runners.name: Kalhandrion
runners.spotlight: Left hurdling form behind to make a winning chase debut at Huntingdon (2m4f, good to soft) and confirmed himself progressive when third at Uttoxeter (beaten 3.5l); gives the impression he'll stay this longer trip.

runners.comment: Should come good in this discipline sooner or later and his yard is having winners
runners.name: The Long Point
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner in 2024; has yet to shine over fences but only had the two attempts and he was runner-up off a higher mark over hurdles; should come good in this discipline sooner or later and his yard is having winners.

runners.comment: Southwell winner; well held off this mark next time but in a Class 3 chase over 3m3f
runners.name: Queens Wish
runners.spotlight: Only her second run over fences when much the best at Southwell (3m, good to soft) in November; beaten about 18l into third off this 7lb higher mark at Market Rasen but that was a Class 3 chase over 3m3f; can do better here.

runners.breeder: G Durrheim And Maria Mulcahy Durrheim
runners.comment: Fell mid-race on his switch to fences when a 14-1 chance at Huntingdon
runners.name: Swift Jet
runners.spotlight: Ran okay to be third of six finishers over hurdles at Ludlow (3m, good to soft; first-time cheekpieces) but fell mid-race on his switch to fences when a 14-1 chance at Huntingdon.

runners.comment: Has improved all of a sudden since fitted with this headgear, winning two Class 5s
runners.name: Jukebox dEddy
runners.spotlight: Has improved all of a sudden since fitted with this headgear, winning Class 5s at Market Rasen (3m, good to soft) and Taunton (3m2f, good); up another 8lb for last time but he had them well strung out and he's receiving plenty of weight from his rivals.

16:00.race_name: Virgin Bet Handicap Hurdle (Go North Brindisi Breeze Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Out of form and difficult to envisage a sudden resurgence at the age of 11
runners.name: Vee Dancer
runners.owner: K P Marsh Plastering & Interiors Ltd
runners.spotlight: Uncompetitive in four starts divided between hurdling and the Flat since returning from a long absence and difficult to envisage a sudden resurgence at the age of 11.

runners.comment: Raised another 6lb for bringing up his hat-trick at Taunton but front two were clear
runners.name: Mask Of Zorro
runners.spotlight: Raised another 6lb for bringing up his hat-trick at Taunton (3m, good; effective on softer) where he short-headed an in-form favourite with the pair dominant; every chance here with the likelihood of even further improvement (only a 6yo).

runners.comment: 2-2 for this yard (hurdle/chase); up 9lb but progressive and should stay this far
runners.name: Passing Pleasure
runners.spotlight: 2-2 for this yard (and in a tongue-tie), having readily won a 2m4f handicap hurdle at Musselburgh (2m4f, soft) and not been overly troubled to defy the same mark on his chase debut at Catterick (2m3f, good to soft); might be progressive enough to cope with a 9lb rise and pointing background offers hope for him seeing out 3m.

runners.comment: Lightly raced; interesting off this low a mark on handicap debut and raised in distance
runners.name: The Two Harrys
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo who was second to a Nicky Henderson hotpot in a 2m4f Plumpton maiden (soft) last time and the winner ran quite well in a warm Windsor handicap last weekend; interesting off this low a mark and now raised in distance.

runners.comment: Dropped back into a Class 4 now but has to prove himself worthy of this mark
runners.name: Be The Difference
runners.spotlight: Recently won three handicaps from 2m5f to 3m within the space of three weeks but an 8lb rise was surely a factor in the 10l defeat at Wetherby (2m5f), albeit in a Class 3; back into a Class 4 now but has to prove himself worthy of this mark.

runners.comment: Whether he'll stay this far remains to be seen but he should have more races in him
runners.name: Ilitch
runners.spotlight: Only 5lb higher than for his Fontwell win last March (2m1f, good) and has returned from a break with competitive runs over 2m4f; whether he'll stay this far remains to be seen but he should have more races in him.

runners.comment: Certainly not progressing; dropping in the weights but he's unraced over this far
runners.name: Balboa
runners.spotlight: Beaten in the region of 10l in 1m7f/2m3f handicaps last month after a break of 183 days; dropping in the weights but he's unraced over this far.

runners.comment: Revitalised veteran who dug deep to defy a 4yo over C&D (good to soft) last month
runners.name: Romeo Brown
runners.spotlight: Revitalised veteran who dug deep to defy a 4yo over C&D (good to soft) last month and he's only 4lb higher with Oscar Palmer again claiming his 7lb; entitled to be involved.

runners.comment: Beaten under 5l on handicap debut (2m3f) and left the impression that further would suit
runners.name: Milan Park
runners.spotlight: Didn't look obviously well treated for his handicap debut at Wetherby (2m3f, soft) but was beaten under 5l and left the impression that further would suit; possibilities.

runners.comment: Tailed off in two handicap hurdles last month but Brian Hughes now takes over
runners.name: Justus
runners.spotlight: Four-time Flat winner and added a small-field novice hurdle over two years ago; big prices and pretty much tailed off in two handicap hurdles last month but Brian Hughes now takes over.

runners.comment: Handicap debutant yet to run beyond 2m; market confidence would heighten interest
runners.name: Greedy Smith
runners.spotlight: Has hinted at ability in two of his four races (including last time) and this well-bred son of Walk In The Park now goes beyond 2m for the first time on his handicap debut; market confidence would heighten interest.

runners.comment: 0-13 for Ben Brookhouse and he's struggled here (8.6f/9.4f) in both runs for current yard
runners.name: Redhot Whisper
runners.spotlight: 0-13 for Ben Brookhouse and he's struggled at big prices here (8.6f/9.4f) in both runs for current yard; hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Runaway winner here (1m4f) in November but his form has nosedived in two runs since
runners.name: Three Yorkshiremen
runners.spotlight: Back to form with a runaway win here (1m4f) in November but he shot up the weights after that success and his form has nosedived in two runs since; now returns to a Class 6 event but he has plenty to prove back at this trip.

runners.comment: C&D winner who is generally reliable and had an excuse at Southwell last time; in the mix
runners.name: Mr Nugget
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D and at Southwell towards the end of last year; didn't fire back at Southwell (1m4f) last Saturday but he had a wide trip round the bend and this 5yo is generally reliable; still looks on a workable mark and he's in the mix.

runners.comment: Demoted to second at Kempton on Monday and he's 2lb well in here; big player
runners.name: Apache Green
runners.spotlight: 0-13 but he was was demoted to second after forcing a dead-heat in 1m handicap at Kempton on Monday (bumped rival close home); 2lb well in off the same mark here and he chased home a subsequent winner at this track (8.6f) on his penultimate run; big player.

runners.comment: Frequent slow starter but he won twice here late last year; dangerous
runners.name: Dingwall
runners.spotlight: Frequent slow starter but he finished first past the post three times here in November/December (demoted on final occasion); never involved over C&D last Friday but a rival's blindfold caused some issues at the start and he's a player if he can get back near his best.

runners.comment: Dead-heated over C&D on Boxing Day and he had tough draw here last time; not ruled out
runners.name: Law Supreme
runners.spotlight: Took advantage of a reduced mark when dead-heating over C&D on Boxing Day; didn't shine under a penalty on his return visit a week later but he had a tough draw and that was behind a dual subsequent winner; up another 2lb but he remains well treated on old form and is not ruled out.

runners.comment: Sole win was on turf last summer and she's struggled since; passed over
runners.name: Purple Sky
runners.spotlight: Won at Down Royal (10.6f, good) for Jim Bolger last July but she's struggled since including when beaten 15l on stable debut at Kempton (Apache Green second) on Monday; passed over.

runners.comment: Won over C&D last Friday and she escapes a penalty for that success; strongly respected
runners.name: Magic Runner
runners.spotlight: Made the breakthrough over C&D early last month and she doubled her tally when finishing well to land an apprentice handicap here (9.4f) last Friday; escapes a penalty for that success and is a major player again if she can repeat the form.

runners.comment: Well held in all five runs and he needs a transformation back in trip
runners.name: El Ghaawy
runners.owner: Jwi Building Solutions J Kelly & Partner
runners.spotlight: Well held in all five runs including two AW handicaps (1m3f) last month; mark continues to fall but that was a heavy defeat last time and he needs a transformation back in trip.

13:27.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: 0-15 but he went close off this mark at Southwell on Saturday; big player
runners.name: Forest Caper
runners.spotlight: 0-15 but he's been placed in three of his last five starts including when a close third in a Southwell handicap (1m, Tapeta) on Saturday; 1lb well in off the same mark here and he's a big player if he can repeat that form.

runners.comment: 0-9 and he struggled on belated handicap debut at Chelmsford; visor is now tried
runners.name: Shamacid
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in four novice/maiden events but he struggled on his belated handicap debut at Chelmsford (7f, AW) three weeks ago; that took his record to 0-9 and he has something to prove after that heavy defeat; first-time visor replaces blinkers.

runners.comment: 0-11 but he had a near miss off this mark at Lingfield on Saturday; respected back in trip
runners.name: Eupator
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing I and Partner
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden who has been expensive to follow but he bounced back with a near miss off this mark at Lingfeld (1m2f, Polytrack) on Saturday; went down fighting in a clear second in that race and he's a major player if he copes with this drop back in trip.

runners.comment: No progress in his qualifying runs and he needs a transformation on handicap debut
runners.name: Al Muddy
runners.spotlight: Showed some ability with his debut fifth at Newcastle (7f) in November but he's been beaten 10l and 14l in two subsequent runs at that track; still early days but he needs a transformation on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Won on debut in July 2024 but he's been regressive since; tongue-tie now added
runners.name: Study Up
runners.spotlight: Made a successful debut for Clive Cox in July 2024 but he's been regressive since and has been well held in both runs (6f/1m) for new yard this winter; still lightly raced but he has plenty to prove back on Tapeta; tongue-tie added.

runners.comment: Win and close third at Lingfield in last two starts and he should go well again
runners.name: Repertoire
runners.spotlight: Ended long losing run with a last-gasp win at Lingfield (1m) three weeks ago and he was only narrowly denied on his return visit 11 days ago; on same mark here and has possibilities if this sets up for his closing style.

runners.comment: Won over C&D 17 days ago but wasn't in the same form back here last Friday; risks attached
runners.name: Fools Rush In
runners.owner: S Thompson And Mrs R Carr
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism off a reduced mark over C&D 17 days ago but he wasn't in the same form back here (fifth of eighth) last Friday; needs to step up again after that and he comes with risks attached.

runners.comment: Improver who won over C&D 11 days ago and he's a big player again under a penalty
runners.name: R P McMurphy
runners.spotlight: Has record of 3313331 in handicaps and he raised his form to a new level when scoring over C&D 11 days ago; has a penalty but that was a comfortable success and he's a big player in his bid to make it 3-4 at this track.

13:57.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Impressive over C&D four weeks ago (runner-up won since); looks a useful prospect
runners.name: Objector
runners.spotlight: Strong at the finish when easily winning a C&D novice four weeks ago, pulling 3l clear of a subsequent winner with another 5.5l back to the third; looked a useful prospect there and he looks to have been found a good opportunity to defy a penalty.

runners.comment: Dropped away on last month's Lingfield debut (1m) but went off at just 4-1; can do better
runners.name: Al Bowlly
runners.spotlight: Attracted some support ahead of his Lingfield debut five weeks ago (1m) but dropped away to finish sixth of the eight runners; open to improvement but it is needed.

runners.comment: Last of five on debut in October (7f, AW); had wind op since; open to improvement
runners.name: Extraterrestrial
runners.spotlight: Ran green and ended up a well-beaten last of five at Southwell on debut in October (7f), after which he underwent wind surgery; should appreciate today's longer trip and he is open to improvement.

runners.comment: Beaten over 8l in two C&D runs this winter; may benefit from a step up in trip
runners.name: Hunterian
runners.spotlight: Both runs over C&D, improving on debut effort when second to an easy winner 17 days ago; open to progress but it may come when stepped up in trip.

14:27.race_name: Midnite, Building The Future Of Betting Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands B-D) (GBB)

runners.comment: Justified support in good style on Newcastle debut in November; respected under penalty
runners.name: Loquella
runners.spotlight: 48,000gns No Nay Never half-sister to Canadian 8.5f turf/AW winner Lupa; well backed into 9-2 on Newcastle debut (6f, Tapeta) in November and she came from off the pace to win by over 3l; that was in a small field and this is tougher under a penalty but she's respected.

runners.comment: 60,000euros yearling; plenty to like on paper and yard was 19% in novice events last year
runners.name: Safe Zone
runners.spotlight: 60,000euros yearling; second foal; Mehmas half-sister to 1m1f/9.4f winner Tachos (RPR 88); dam 7f winner (including AW; 83), sister to US 1m4f Grade 1 winner Glorious Empire, half-sister to 7f Group 3 winner Goldana; plenty to like on paper and yard was 19% in novice events last year.

runners.comment: Promising third here (7f) last month and she's open to more progress on this drop to 6f
runners.name: Fair Y Isle
runners.spotlight: Ran green after a slow start on debut in November but she left that form behind when a promising third here (7f) three weeks ago; took a strong hold in that race and she's open to more progress on this drop to 6f; interesting contender.

runners.comment: Well held at big prices in three turf runs (5f) last summer, with best RPR of 34
runners.name: Lady Of Honour
runners.spotlight: Well held at big prices in three turf runs (5f) last summer, with a best RPR of 34; can only be watched on her return.

runners.comment: Made a low-key start at Chelmsford and she needs plenty of progress upped in trip; hood on
runners.name: Mayflyer
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to three winners but was never involved when fifth of eight on recent Chelmsford debut (5f, AW; 14-1); should know more this time but she needs plenty of progress upped in trip; hood added.

runners.comment: Made promising start when fourth at Chelmsford and she's a player if she can build on that
runners.name: Preferred
runners.spotlight: Well-bred filly who made an encouraging start when fourth of nine at Chelmsford (6f, AW) two weeks ago; was beaten less than 2l in that race and she's a player if she can build on that.

15:02.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Classified Stakes (Div I)

runners.comment: Came from off the pace to win a C&D handicap last week; solid claims despite 5lb penalty
runners.name: Piperstown
runners.spotlight: Back to form with a bang when readily landing a C&D handicap last week, coming from off the pace to score by 2l; has to give weight away but he still has more to recommend him than most.

runners.comment: Came up short in hat-trick bid here 11 days ago but still a solid contender in this field
runners.name: Midnight Call
runners.spotlight: Came up shy when a 2l third of six in her hat-trick bid here 11 days ago; still has time to resume her progress and she can't be ruled out.

runners.comment: Good chance on her November 3rd here; not well drawn on last two runs; can go well
runners.name: Mintana
runners.spotlight: Placed over C&D in November and a repeat of that form would bring her right into the mix; two subsequent efforts less good but she is better drawn today and a revival could be imminent.

runners.comment: Poor strike-rate and well beaten back from a long absence two weeks ago
runners.name: Musaytir
runners.spotlight: Just one win to his name after 48 starts; well-beaten 100-1 shot on his stable debut 13 days ago (after 558-day absence); hard to fancy.

runners.comment: 15-race maiden; fair effort after a break here 17 days ago; others appeal more though
runners.name: Oldbury Lad
runners.spotlight: 15-race maiden but snippets of form and his return from a break here 17 days ago wasn't without hope; others appeal more all the same.

runners.comment: Out of sorts of late and he can't be recommended at present
runners.name: Poet
runners.spotlight: Badly out of sorts of late, including both runs in blinkers; can't be recommended at present.

runners.comment: C&D winner; ended 2025 with some fair runs but needs to pull out more to win here
runners.name: Rogue Thunder
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; ended 2025 with some fair runs here but he needs to raise his game if he is to record a second win.

runners.comment: Well drawn to attack and this winter's Newcastle form gives him solid claims
runners.name: Superior Council
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer; beat 13 rivals when scoring at Newcastle in November and he has run a string of good races in defeat since; well drawn and this sharper track should suit; high on the list.

runners.comment: Not the force of old; flicker of promise last time but others bring more pressing claims
runners.name: Symbol Of Hope
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner down the years but he is not the force of old; latest effort suggested a smidgen of ability remained but others bring more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Midfield behind Piperstown here last week & 10lb better off; down in grade but drawn wide
runners.name: The Cutest
runners.spotlight: Yet to shine for her current stable but last week's midfield finish behind Piperstown was a step back in the right direction; 10lb better off with that rival on this first foray into 0-50 company but she's drawn widest.

15:37.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Classified Stakes (Div II)

runners.comment: Multiple C&D winner; Lingfield win 11 days ago; penalised/drawn wide but still a contender
runners.name: Beauzon
runners.spotlight: Multiple C&D winner; good third here 17 days ago was followed by a ready win at Lingfield 11 days ago (cheekpieces back on, retained); drawn wide and has a 4lb penalty but still a strong contender.

runners.comment: Near miss over C&D earlier in the month; fair 3rd at Southwell yesterday; each-way shout
runners.name: Autumn Angel
runners.spotlight: Went close in a similar C&D event 17 days ago; not seen to best effect in a handicap here last week but she had no excuses when third over 7f at Southwell yesterday; each-way shout.

runners.comment: Shaping as though a return to 6f might suit; not ruled out in a race lacking depth
runners.name: Bossy Parker
runners.spotlight: Registered all wins at 7f but both efforts this year suggest this return to 6f is worth a go; not ruled out at this level.

runners.comment: Front-runner; conditions to suit and dangerous if left alone early
runners.name: Eldeyaar
runners.spotlight: Front-runner; fully effective under the conditions but he dropped away having set strong fractions here last week; chance if left alone up front but that wouldn't be assured.

runners.comment: On a losing run and readily seen off by Beauzon 11 days ago; opposable for win purposes
runners.name: Miss Moonshine
runners.spotlight: Getting on for two years since the last of her four wins; put in her place by Beauzon at Lingfield 11 days ago and opposable for win purposes once again.

runners.comment: Faces optimum conditions; return of headgear a plus and Billy Loughnane booked; chance
runners.name: My Boy Jack
runners.spotlight: Frustrating performer who tends to get going too late; that said, all three of his wins have come over C&D and when sporting headgear so the return of a visor looks a plus; Billy Loughnane booked and a big run should be forthcoming.

runners.comment: Didn't progress for Kevin Ryan; tongue tied on stable debut; far from solid
runners.name: Queen Dinah
runners.spotlight: Failed to progress for Kevin Ryan, including in two Class 6 handicaps after wind surgery; returns for new stable (same owner) after a 238-day absence; tongue tie now added.

runners.comment: Yet to find her best for current stable; others have much less to prove
runners.name: She Went Whoosh
runners.spotlight: Not found her best form for new stable and Monday's fourth over 5f here wasn't enough to earn her the verdict.

runners.comment: Latest 3rd over C&D was okay but without suggesting he was the answer here
runners.name: Sisters In The Sky
runners.spotlight: Generally struggled since Bath win last June; managed third over C&D 17 days ago but beaten over 3l at the finish; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Exposed low-grade maiden; returns from 12 weeks off with plenty to find
runners.name: Twilight Poppy
runners.spotlight: Exposed low-grade maiden; returns from 12 weeks off with plenty to find.

16:10.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap

runners.comment: Completed 6f hat-trick in good style last week; 3lb well in under penalty; drop to 5f a ?
runners.name: Lazzar
runners.spotlight: Completed a Polytrack hat-trick when scooting clear in a 6f handicap at Chelmsford last week; 3lb well in under a penalty and should have the pace to cope with this drop back in trip, albeit it remains a slight query.

runners.comment: Looked good on debut but 2025 was disappointing; drops in trip/class with a point to prove
runners.name: Rogue Allegiance
runners.spotlight: Looked promising when winning on debut at Newcastle (6f) in December 2024; struggled in 2025 though and the drop in trip/class isn't enough to tempt in this field.

runners.comment: Stayed on strongly to win over C&D on Boxing Day; Billy Loughnane 2-5 for the yard; solid
runners.name: El Bufalo
runners.spotlight: Off the mark for his new yard with a C&D success on Boxing Day, running on well in the straight; a 2lb rise shouldn't prevent another prominent showing and Billy Loughnane is 2-5 for the stable.

runners.comment: C&D win last month came in Class 6; got the start wrong latest; others appeal more
runners.name: Blue Force
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner
runners.spotlight: Well backed when winning a Class 6 over C&D last month; awkward at the start and never a threat in a Class 5 back here three weeks ago; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Infrequent winner in Ireland but 5f on AW no problem; market useful on stable debut
runners.name: Tomarlo
runners.spotlight: Won just one of his 18 starts in Ireland for David Marnane but he was in fair form in the latter part of 2025; sold for 9,500gns last month and given a wind op soon after; market useful on stable debut.

runners.comment: Multiple C&D winner and arrives in good form; opposable in this grade though
runners.name: Gustav Graves
runners.spotlight: Nine-time AW winner; arrives in good order but it has been a while since he last won outside of Class 6 company.

runners.comment: Won two of his last four but penalised for Tuesday's narrow win and this is tougher
runners.name: Street Life
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer who has won two of his last four starts (including C&D); a 4lb penalty for Tuesday's narrow Southwell success could leave him vulnerable though.

16:40.race_name: BetMGM Supports Safer Gambling Fillies' Handicap

runners.comment: Two wins for current yard and she's been knocking on the door in last two runs; respected
runners.name: Nivelles Magic
runners.spotlight: Has form figures of 513143222 for her current yard and she hit a personal best when going close at Kempton (1m3f, Polytrack) last month; only 1lb higher here and she's a big player again back on Tapeta.

runners.comment: Eight-race maiden who was beaten 12l on her reappearance last month; down the list
runners.name: Word Of Mouth
runners.spotlight: Went close off 3lb higher at Hamilton (1m3f, good) last June but she's finished down the field in three starts since; may have needed her reappearance run at Newcastle last month but that was a 12l defeat and she's now 0-8; others preferred.

runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo but she needs improvement at new trip for new yard; hood off
runners.name: Berezka
runners.spotlight: Well-bred filly but she hasn't progressed so far and was a well-held sixth on handicap debut at Newcastle (1m2f, AW) in November; left Harry Charlton for 20,000gns since; still early days but she needs improvement upped in trip for new yard; hood worn last time is removed.

runners.comment: Runner-up in last four starts and she didn't get much luck at Newcastle latest; key player
runners.name: Cardinal Point
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Cxxi And Partner
runners.spotlight: Two wins since returned to AW in September and she's finished runner-up in her last four starts; didn't get much luck when a close second at Newcastle (1m4f, Tapeta) two weeks ago and she's a key player off only 1lb higher here.

runners.comment: Dual course winner but she's lost her way and still has something to prove at this trip
runners.name: Flaine
runners.spotlight: Back from a break with two narrow wins here (9.4f) in the autumn but her spark has been missing in last four runs; now only 1lb higher than for her last win, but slow starts have been an issue recently and she still has something to prove at this trip; first-time eyeshields.

runners.comment: Comfortable win at Southwell (1m4f) last Saturday and she's respected under a penalty
runners.name: Hackney Diamonds
runners.spotlight: Has won at Southwell in two of her last four starts including in a 1m4f handicap last Saturday; has a penalty but that was a comfortable success and she remains feasibly treated on her best form; respected.

13:05.race_name: Hazelton Mountford Insurance Brokers EBF Junior "National Hunt" Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Well on top at Haydock and Toby McCain-Mitchell's claim erases most of the penalty
runners.name: Diamond Jim
runners.spotlight: Only blip came in a Listed race; ran well on debut (soft) behind a subsequent winner and was well on top late on at Haydock (good); Toby McCain-Mitchell's claim erases most of the penalty so certainly has each-way claims.

runners.comment: Travelled well but weakened to be about 12l off the winner at Doncaster; more needed
runners.name: Dreams Ka
runners.spotlight: Travelled well but weakened to be about 12l off the winner at Doncaster (good to soft) and he'll probably need to leave that form well behind if he's to be winning this.

runners.comment: Runner-up in France and he's entered in the Triumph; of obvious interest for top team
runners.name: Feel Gut
runners.spotlight: Promising second over hurdles on sole French start (the winner has since finished second for Willie Mullins) and has to be of interest now kicking off for top owners who also recruited the winner of that Auteuil race; with a Triumph entry, he's of major interest.

runners.comment: Found wanting on his Lingfield debut but ran well to be 6l off a previous winner
runners.name: Majeur Allen
runners.spotlight: Found wanting on his Lingfield debut (good to soft) but ran well to be 6l off a previous winner and at 15-8 he was evidently well fancied; improvement is on the cards.

runners.comment: Beaten 28l in an Aintree bumper and 22l in a juvenile hurdle; headgear soon turned to
runners.name: Maxios Aurelius
runners.spotlight: Beaten 28l in an Aintree bumper and 22l in a juvenile hurdle at Exeter (both good to soft); headgear is soon turned to.

runners.breeder: E A R L Trinquet & M & O Trinquet
runners.comment: Promising second at Wincanton and probably bumped into a very good horse (now 2-2)
runners.name: Mecene
runners.spotlight: Well related and probably bumped into a good horse (now 2-2 after beating Diamond Jim the run before) when beaten 3.5l at Wincanton in early December (good to soft); more needed here but that's very feasible.

runners.comment: A 9l second here in Nov and did okay considering she showed inexperience in her jumping
runners.name: Enya
runners.owner: Sheep As A Lamb Syndicate Gary Gillies
runners.spotlight: No match for the winner here in November (good to soft) but did okay considering she showed inexperience in her jumping and she was a market mover at 13-8; better expected.

runners.comment: Both starts in bumpers, better effort when midfield at Newbury last time
runners.name: Lets Go Mo
runners.spotlight: Both starts in bumpers, better effort when midfield at Newbury last time; would be a surprise winner of this on her hurdling debut.

13:35.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At Betano Mares' Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Course bumper winner; back on track with Ludlow hurdle success last month; respected
runners.name: Bettys Daisy
runners.spotlight: Won soft-ground course bumper in good style last February and bounced back from disappointing seasonal/hurdle debut with clearcut success at Ludlow (2m5f, good to soft; first-time tongue-tie) last month; meets a tough opponent here but has more to offer.

runners.comment: Newbury winner; drops in grade after running well in Haydock Listed race last month
runners.name: Jackie Hobbs
runners.spotlight: Point and dual bumper winner; too good for a subsequent Listed winner when scoring on seasonal/hurdle debut at Newbury (2m, good to soft) in November and not discredited when close fourth in Haydock Listed race (2m3f, good to soft) last month; in calmer waters here and an obvious contender.

runners.comment: Bought for £70,000 after battling well to win Wexford bumper in October; hurdle debut
runners.name: Ballymoreen
runners.spotlight: Battled well to pip Willie Mullins-trained hotpot in Wexford bumper (yielding ground; front pair well clear) in October, her third start; changed hands for £70,000 the following month and Sean Bowen is booked for this stable/hurdle debut.

runners.comment: Well beaten in all three bumpers; makes no appeal on hurdling debut
runners.name: Blacksambelle
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in all three bumpers, most recently in race won by Betty's Daisy here last February; makes no appeal on hurdle debut.

runners.comment: Made a low-key debut over 2m5f here last month
runners.name: Camshaft
runners.spotlight: Out of a well-connected mare and represents a good stable but made a low-key debut over 2m5f here last month.

runners.comment: Point winner who looked very promising in bumpers in the autumn; hurdle debut
runners.name: Edith Pelham
runners.spotlight: Joined Fergal O'Brien after point win on debut a year ago; launched rules career with narrow win in Aintree bumper (good to soft) in October and was respectable sixth in Listed grade at Cheltenham (soft; 7l behind Shotgun Shirley) the following month; up in trip for hurdle debut; good prospect.

runners.comment: Always behind when 150-1 for last month's hurdling debut (2m)
runners.name: Hey Flint
runners.spotlight: Showed promise in both her bumpers but was always behind when 150-1 for last month's hurdling debut (2m).

runners.comment: Sprawled on landing at first flight and was ultimately well beaten on hurdle debut
runners.name: Independent Lady
runners.spotlight: Kept on for respectable fourth on bumper debut at Uttoxeter (good to soft) in October but was soundly beaten (albeit after sprawling on landing at first flight) on hurdle debut at Windsor (2m, good to soft) two months ago and has a lot to find here.

runners.comment: Showed no significant promise in a bumper and two hurdle races (2m/2m3f) in early 2023
runners.name: Lily Grace
runners.spotlight: Showed no significant promise in a bumper and two hurdle races (2m/2m3f) in early 2023; Venetia Williams is persisting with her but she can only be watched on this first start for 1,001 days.

runners.comment: Irish point winner; clear second to useful rival on last month's rules debut at Huntingdon
runners.name: Lisnamurrican
runners.spotlight: Won soft-ground Irish point in December 2024 and, following a one-year absence, was clear second to useful rival on stable/hurdle debut at Huntingdon (2m4f, soft); will be a tough nut to crack if able to build on that performance here.

runners.comment: Pulled up when 300-1 for debut at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month
runners.name: Lunar Lily
runners.spotlight: Pulled up when 300-1 for debut at Southwell (2m, good to soft) last month.

runners.comment: Placed in two bumpers last spring but a well-beaten 66-1 shot on recent hurdle debut
runners.name: Moorsbrook
runners.spotlight: Placed in two good-ground bumpers last spring, including 250-1 third of 18 at Cheltenham, but a well-beaten 66-1 shot on last month's hurdle debut (2m; raced too freely).

runners.comment: Did not show enough in her two bumpers to suggest she can threaten here
runners.name: Roberta Bishop
runners.spotlight: Did not show enough in her two bumpers to suggest she can threaten the principals on this hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Second in a Listed bumper; ran better than finishing position suggests on hurdling debut
runners.name: Shotgun Shirley
runners.spotlight: Won good-ground Uttoxeter bumper in first-time hood in October, her third start, and took another step forward when second in soft-ground Listed race at Cheltenham in November; didn't get home after racing too freely on last month's hurdling debut at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft) but ran well for a long way there; could have a say if she settles better here.

runners.comment: Placed in fast-ground point bumper last April but soundly beaten on both rules starts
runners.name: Silver Gale
runners.spotlight: Placed in a fast-ground point bumper last April but soundly beaten on both starts under rules (bumper/2m hurdle).

runners.comment: Pulled up when 150-1 for 2m5f Ludlow novice hurdle won by Betty's Daisy on rules debut
runners.name: Wishful Wings
runners.spotlight: Pulled up when 150-1 for 2m5f Ludlow novice hurdle won by Betty's Daisy on last month's rules debut.

14:05.race_name: Betano Backing British Racing Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage De Busset
runners.comment: Bang-in-form 7yo who ended 2025 with two convincing wins; commands respect
runners.name: Jour dEvasion
runners.spotlight: Bang-in-form 7yo who ended 2025 with convincing wins at Bangor (2m1f, heavy) and Chepstow (2m, good to soft); shooting up the weights but won't mind what the weather does here and commands respect in current mood.

runners.comment: Disappointing favourite last month but can still progress from ready C&D win in November
runners.name: Excelero
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner who built on encouraging seasonal/chase debut when readily winning three-runner C&D (soft) contest in November; raced too freely and was disappointing favourite at Ascot last month but remains one to be interested in.

runners.comment: Well beaten on handicap hurdle debut still looks interesting on this switch to fences
runners.name: Cobblers Boy
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 6yo who did not need to improve to win run-of-the-mill maiden hurdle here (2m, good) last spring; returned from break with disappointing handicap hurdle debut last month and his tendency to race too freely remains a concern but Dan Skelton is evidently very keen to switch this Irish point runner-up to chasing.

runners.breeder: E A R L De Lustiere
runners.comment: Well handicapped on old hurdle form; returned from long layoff with disappointing run
runners.name: Inca De Lafayette
runners.spotlight: Three-time hurdle winner who returned from long layoff with disappointing 2m5f run last month; remains well handicapped on old form and ought to be suited by this drop back in trip but is quite tricky to weigh up before this chasing debut.

runners.comment: 2-3 over hurdles; ran no race on chase debut but could still have significant potential
runners.name: Epic West
runners.spotlight: Irish point winner who was 2-3 as a novice hurdler last season (wins gained on soft/good to soft); ran no race on chase/handicap debut at Kempton (2m4f, good) on Boxing Day but still looks a good prospect and will be fine over this shorter trip.

14:37.race_name: Betano Boosted Odds Every UK Race Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Stayers Hurdle Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Has a lot of weight and was only fifth at Haydock last time, behind Gwennie May Star
runners.name: Imperial Merlin
runners.spotlight: Only 1lb higher than for his Haydock win over a similar trip last March; does have a lot of weight though and was only fifth at Haydock last time, finishing just behind Gwennie May Star.

runners.comment: Off since October; looks high in the weights now but he's likeably consistent
runners.name: Hostile Hotelier
runners.spotlight: Had a break since finishing lame when second on his return to hurdles at Newcastle in October (2m7f, good; handles softer); looks high in the weights now but he's likeably consistent.

runners.comment: First and second in staying handicaps back over hurdles; tough mark but respected
runners.name: Jalisco Star
runners.spotlight: Struggles continued over fences in November but first and second in staying handicaps back over hurdles and has looked progressive in this discipline for a while now; perhaps has no margin for error off current mark (different 7lb claimer rode last time) but she enters the reckoning.

runners.comment: Lightly raced and a solid enough run last time; possibilities in the new cheekpieces
runners.name: Dwight K Schrute
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner; fell on chase debut in November but competitive in hurdle races either side of that, last time beaten under 4l at Fontwell (3m2f, good to soft; Jalisco Star second); possibilities should the cheekpieces have a positive effect, with Gavin Sheehan replacing a 7lb claimer.

runners.breeder: Haras De Nonant Le Pin & M-F Corbiere
runners.comment: Only his fourth run and a first handicap when a rallying second over 2m5f here last month
runners.name: Libre De Choeur
runners.spotlight: Only his fourth run and a first handicap when a rallying second over 2m5f here last month (good to soft); makes sense to go further on the evidence of that run; respected.

runners.comment: Thoroughly exposed; good chase effort three runs back and returns to hurdling here
runners.name: Wa Wa
runners.spotlight: Had lots of racing in Ireland before joining this yard last year; won a 3m2f handicap hurdle at Perth last April (good to soft; 2lb lower) and one of his three recent chase runs was very respectable; exposed but has each-way claims.

runners.comment: Rain is forecast and his best run was two starts back when second on soft ground
runners.name: Seatoit
runners.owner: Julie And David R Martin And Dan Hall
runners.spotlight: No wins in eight but nearly put that right on soft at Ffos Las (3m) and drier ground put forward as an excuse here on New Year's Eve; with rain about, he has to be feared.

runners.breeder: Sc Racing Investment Society Ecurie Ris
runners.comment: In form and Sean Bowen takes over from a 5lb claimer who has been aboard the last twice
runners.name: Gwennie May Star
runners.spotlight: Won twice in these colours for Dan Skelton and it was over C&D he made a successful return to hurdling in November (soft); not quite at the same level when fourth at Haydock; Sean Bowen takes over from a 5lb claimer who has been aboard the last twice.

runners.breeder: Ecurie Biraben D Biraben & A Biraben
runners.comment: Returns to hurdling off a useful mark and she's won twice in this discipline
runners.name: Kosasiempre
runners.spotlight: Has been chasing and won around Hereford in November (3m1f, good), despite jumping out to her left; repeated the dose when only fourth there last month; returns to hurdling off a useful mark and she's won twice in this discipline.

runners.comment: Not far away at Lingfield when giving the impression that race would bring him on
runners.name: Has Troke
runners.spotlight: After two pull-ups over fences he won back hurdling at Lingfield 11 months ago (2m7f, soft; 5lb lower); wasn't far away there last month when giving the impression that race would bring him on; considered.

15:12.race_name: David Launchbury Memorial Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Won small-field chase in September; changed stables after two poor runs
runners.name: Just A Memory
runners.spotlight: Narrowly won small-field 2m5f chase for Tom Ellis in September but her next two runs (3m2f, hurdle/chase) were very disappointing; might be aided by refitted tongue-tie here but still looks risky on stable debut; blinkers removed after one use; drops back in trip.

runners.comment: 0-7 over hurdles but ran quite well at Windsor on New Year's Day; up in trip here
runners.name: Midnight View
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in first two handicaps but fared much better on next two outings, more recently when fourth of 11 at Windsor (2m, good) on New Year's Day; a possible if suited by the slower ground/longer trip here.

runners.comment: Suited by step up to 2m3f when close third at Huntingdon last month; likely contender
runners.name: Pottersmattyeeehaa
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles but looked suited by the step up in trip when close third at Huntingdon (2m3f, good to soft; unraced on anything slower) last month and features prominently in calculations here.

runners.comment: Ran well on good ground in November but well held on heavy since; forecast rain a worry
runners.name: An Buachaill Rua
runners.spotlight: Left disappointing handicap debut behind when very respectable fifth of 12 at Hereford (2m3f, good) in November; last month's heavy-ground defeat can probably be excused but the forecast rain is a worry here.

runners.comment: Placed twice on good ground in new cheekpieces in the autumn; tired on soft last time
runners.name: Isabel De Clare
runners.spotlight: Seemingly boosted by new cheekpieces when placed twice at Ludlow (2m5f, good) in the autumn; has claims if judged on those efforts but finished tired on soft ground last month and is now 0-11 over hurdles.

runners.comment: Good third behind much improved mare at Hereford last month; high on the list
runners.name: Conniemak
runners.spotlight: Launched handicap career with two low-key 2m runs but her third behind a much improved mare at Hereford (2m3f, good to soft) last month was much better and she ought to cope if the ground is slower here; high on the list.

runners.comment: Ran well in defeat over 3m2f here last March but not seen since
runners.name: Just Four Fame
runners.spotlight: 0-10 over hurdles; went down fighting when second here (3m2f, good) last March but we haven't seen him since and this drop back in trip may not be ideal.

runners.comment: Yet to be placed after six hurdle runs; others have much more obvious claims
runners.name: Milan Milos
runners.owner: Team Payne Powell Ray And Warburton
runners.spotlight: Not beaten that far in his first two handicaps (2m4f/2m2f) and a bad jumping error contributed to his 43l defeat last time but others in this line-up have more compelling claims.

runners.comment: 0-7 over hurdles; absent since last April but this drop back in trip ought to suit
runners.name: Jukebox Joker
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles; absent since looking stretched by 3m at Ffos Las last April but his keeping-on fourth over 2m4f (soft) there three starts ago suggests he can feature here if fully tuned up.

runners.comment: Placed on seasonal debut but below that form last time and now 0-15 over hurdles
runners.name: Churchman
runners.spotlight: Gave pretty good account when third on seasonal debut at Ludlow (2m, good) in November and should also be suited by today's trip on slower ground but his latest run was below par and he's now 0-15 over hurdles.

runners.comment: Showed nothing more than minor promise in her three qualifying races; handicap debut
runners.name: Half Pint Daisy
runners.spotlight: Showed nothing more than minor promise in her three qualifying races (2m-2m1f) and needs significant improvement on this handicap debut.

runners.comment: Has lowly mark for handicap debut but still makes very limited appeal
runners.name: Ifan Full Pelt
runners.spotlight: Struggled to get competitive when a big-priced outsider for four novices hurdles at around 2m; has lowly mark for handicap debut but still makes very limited appeal.

runners.comment: 0-7 over hurdles, having been pulled up on last three appearances; tongue-tie added
runners.name: DGesteevo
runners.spotlight: 0-7 over hurdles, having been pulled up on last three appearances, and needs first time tongue-tie to make a big difference; cheekpieces (worn for last two races); removed.

15:47.race_name: Bet 10 Get 30 At Betano Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Dominated over 2m4f here at end of 2024 but returned with underwhelming run last month
runners.name: Noche Negra
runners.spotlight: Jumped well and dominated from the front here (2m4f, soft) on stable debut at end of 2024 but wasn't seen again until 34l defeat at Leicester (2m4f, good to soft) last month and is not proven over this far.

runners.comment: Returned from latest long absent with very respectable fourth at Hereford last month
runners.name: Nambiti
runners.spotlight: Dual chase winner in France in 2021 (2m1f/2m3f); very lightly raced in recent years but returned from latest long layoff with fair fourth at Hereford (3m1f, good to soft) last month and remains unexposed over this trip.

runners.breeder: S Shiel D Savage & T Nolan
runners.comment: Back from long absence with two very promising chase runs last month (2m4f/2m7f)
runners.name: He Knows Better
runners.owner: Mrs Isobel Webb & Mrs Julie Fowler
runners.spotlight: In process of running big race before penultimate-fence fall on last month's chase debut at Haydock (2m4f, good to soft; first run after long absence) and kept on well for second when upped to 2m7f at Huntingdon (good to soft) on next outing; should cope if the ground ends up soft/heavy here and could have untapped potential over this even longer trip.

runners.comment: Course winner over hurdles last March but out of sorts in two chases last month
runners.name: El Saviour
runners.spotlight: Recovered from bad jumping error on final circuit to make winning handicap hurdle debut here (2m5f, soft) last March but looked out of sorts in two chases last month and it takes a big leap of faith to support him today.

runners.comment: 2m4f course winner on chase debut; has since run well again over that trip at Cheltenham
runners.name: Kalista Love
runners.owner: Hot To Trot Jumping And Dahlbury
runners.spotlight: Kept on well to make winning chase debut here (2m4f) in November and probably ran just as well when close fifth of 15 in competitive mares' race at Cheltenham (also 2m4f, good to soft) last month; big player if suited by this move up in trip.

runners.comment: Won twice for Olly Murphy in autumn but soundly beaten here for new yard on New Year's Eve
runners.name: Pescatorius
runners.spotlight: In good form for Olly Murphy in the autumn, winning in blinkers at Sedgefield (3m2f, good to firm) and Market Rasen (2m5f, good to soft), but was soundly beaten in cheekpieces here (2m4f, good to soft) for new stable on New Year's Eve and now has a point to prove.

runners.comment: Went very close here on chasing debut and won by 20l at Uttoxeter soon afterwards
runners.name: House Of Habsburg
runners.spotlight: Very close second here (3m, soft; front pair well clear) on last month's chasing debut and stayed on strongly to win gruelling contest by 20l at Uttoxeter (3m, heavy) a few days later; 10lb higher now but sure to be suited by the forecast rain and commands respect.

runners.comment: Three respectable runs this autumn; needs more over this new trip; forecast rain a worry
runners.name: Yorgunnabeplucky
runners.spotlight: Beat three rivals to win on chase debut at Ffos Las (2m, good to soft) last June and returned from break with three respectable runs in the autumn (2m6f-2m7f; cheekpieces added last time); has the services of Sean Bowen for first venture beyond 3m but this race looks more competitive and he'll have something to prove if the ground turns soft.

16:18.race_name: Willoughby De Broke Open Hunters' Chase

runners.comment: Very useful at his best, albeit with very mixed record in Britain; hunter chase debut
runners.name: Golden Son
runners.spotlight: Very useful handicapper at his best, albeit with very mixed record in Britain; absent since well-held third at Newbury (2m7f, good) last March but has possibilities if in the right mood on hunter chase debut.

runners.comment: As good as ever in recent handicaps; ought to be hard to beat on hunter chase return
runners.name: Jet Plane
runners.spotlight: Commendable second in last season's Aintree Foxhunters' (2m5f, good to soft) and as good as ever in recent 2m4f handicaps; stays 3m well and won't be fazed if the ground turns soft (unraced on heavy); ought to be hard to beat on return to hunter chasing.

runners.comment: Ran well from the front when fourth in open point last month; considered each-way
runners.name: One True King
runners.spotlight: Not the force of old and might be better suited by right-handed tracks but ran well from the front when close fourth in open point at left-handed Chaddesley Corbett (3m, good to soft; also suited by soft) last month; considered each-way.

runners.comment: Thorough stayer; ran well in quite valuable handicap on latest outing last May; a player
runners.name: Slipway
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Mrs S N J Embiricos
runners.spotlight: Thorough stayer who was very respectable fifth of 14 in quite valuable Uttoxeter handicap (3m, good) on latest outing in May; also suited by soft ground and has big role to play if fully tuned up for hunter chase debut; blinkers removed after one use.

runners.comment: Won this race in 2024 but he's 13 now and needs to prove he still has what it takes
runners.name: DJango
runners.spotlight: Won this race in 2024 (soft ground) but never really got going last season and was very disappointing favourite in a point last month, after a layoff; now a teenager and needs to prove he still has what it takes.

runners.comment: Absent since below-par Ludlow run last April but not out of this if back on song
runners.name: Havent Time
runners.spotlight: Won soft-ground Southwell hunter chase in spring 2024 and was clear second at Taunton (2m7f, good to soft) last February, after a break; absent since below-par Ludlow run last April but not out of this if back on song.

runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.name: Time Leader
runners.owner: G&s Capper M Loran L Doyle
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

runners.comment: Absent since running respectably in Grand Steeple-Chase de Paris in May 2023
runners.name: Franco De Port
runners.spotlight: Grade 1 novice chase winner for Willie Mullins in 2020 but absent since running respectably in Grand Steeple-Chase de Paris in May 2023 and it's very hard to gauge how much ability he retains.

runners.comment: Placed in Newbury veterans' chase last March and has good record when fresh; shortlisted
runners.name: Good Boy Bobby
runners.spotlight: Six-time chase winner; long in the tooth now but was placed in Newbury veterans' chase (3m2f, soft) on latest outing last March and has a good record when fresh; shortlised on hunter chase debut.

runners.comment: Struggled in latest point; of interest only if ground become very testing
runners.name: Paul Marvel
runners.owner: N&k Richards L&b Doyle M&k Shore
runners.spotlight: Won heavy-ground point by wide margin in November and may warrant each-way consideration if conditions become very testing here but he struggled in his latest point and others in this field have much stronger claims.

16:45.race_name: Win 250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap

runners.comment: C&D win in November has been followed by some solid efforts; new headgear today
runners.name: Amber Honey
runners.spotlight: Stayed on well to win a C&D handicap in November off just 2lb lower; creditable efforts since and a change of headgear could give her a lift (ran well when both blinkers and cheekpieces were on for the first time).

runners.comment: C&D record reads 221; not at best last time but could resume progress back here
runners.name: Marry The Night
runners.spotlight: Two wins last year, the latest over C&D in November off 3lb lower; not so good at Newcastle six weeks ago but a C&D record of 221 means a revival would be no surprise.

runners.comment: Three Newcastle wins last year; not at best last time but could resume progress for R Ryan
runners.name: Coramento
runners.spotlight: Won three handicaps at Newcastle after joining this yard last March; only midfield at that track three weeks ago but still feasibly weighted and Rossa Ryan is booked.

runners.breeder: Haras DLa Riviere Mme Liza Judd
runners.comment: Looked good over C&D in October but two lesser runs have followed; still low mileage
runners.name: Quite Sweet
runners.spotlight: Looked as though she could make a mark in better company when easily seeing off ten rivals over C&D in October, her second handicap run; two lesser efforts have followed but perhaps the return to Southwell can see her resume her progress.

runners.comment: Two C&D wins in October; fair effort at Newcastle latest; others appeal more
runners.name: Heretic
runners.spotlight: Won twice over C&D last October, the second win coming off just 1lb lower; ran okay at Newcastle when last seen five weeks ago but others appeal more for win purposes.

runners.comment: 1m nursery winner in September 2024; absent 477 days; unexposed and worth a market check
runners.name: Force Of Honour
runners.spotlight: Won a 1m Redcar nursery for Craig Lidster in September 2024 off a 3lb lower mark; gelded during his 477-day absence; not fully exposed and he is worth a market check on his belated return.

runners.breeder: Highpark B/Stock Ltd & Akuna B/Stock Ltd
runners.comment: This month's C&D win was followd by a close second at Wolverhampton last week; big player
runners.name: Imola
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 22nd attempt when beating Amarachi over C&D 17 days ago; better form when short-headed by another in-form sort at Wolverhampton last week; 1lb lower today and should go well again.

runners.comment: Dropped 40lb in eight runs for this yard; only of interest if backed
runners.name: Oviedo
runners.spotlight: Started out for this yard last August rated 40lb higher; will find his level at some point but only of interest if backed.

runners.comment: Ex-Irish maiden; starts out for new yard off a lowly mark and needs a close market check
runners.name: Cezarro
runners.spotlight: Promise for John O'Donoghue last summer but he was well beaten in four runs for Alan McIntyre from September onwards; starts out for new stable off a reduced mark and he should find this less competitive than he is used to.

runners.comment: 5lb better off with Imola for 2.75l on recent C&D form; unexposed at 1m but needs more
runners.name: Amarachi
runners.spotlight: None too consistent but she ran a solid race when chasing home Imola over C&D 17 days ago, her first attempt at a mile; 5lb turnaround in the weights here but she will need to pull out more to win.

runners.comment: Unplaced in all eight starts and easy enough to have reservations
runners.name: Sold Out
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in all eight starts and easy enough to have reservations.

17:15.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Recorded a poor RPR at Wolverhampton on belated debut
runners.name: Calypso Bloom
runners.spotlight: 5yo mare; recorded a poor RPR at Wolverhampton (9.5f) on belated debut and is likely best watched until handicapping.

runners.comment: Modest fifth of seven over C&D on belated debut
runners.name: No Further Action
runners.spotlight: 6yo mare; modest fifth of seven in C&D contest on belated debut.

runners.comment: 0-7 for Charles Hills; the most exposed contender in this field
runners.name: Nuptown Girl
runners.spotlight: The most exposed contender in this field, having been 0-7 for Charles Hills; sold for 5,000gns since last run; best to look elsewhere unless the market speaks favourably.

runners.comment: Absent since finishing seventh of eight at Newcastle 16 months ago
runners.name: Sweet Scent
runners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum
runners.spotlight: Absent since finishing only seventh of eight in 7f maiden at Newcastle 16 months ago; opposed unless the betting suggests otherwise.

runners.comment: Needs to step up sharply on her Kempton effort
runners.name: Darn Hot Dame
runners.spotlight: Beat only one rival in eight-runner field at Kempton (7f); needs to step up sharply on the bare form.

runners.breeder: Airlie Stud & Mrs S M Rogers
runners.comment: Went very close at Lingfield for new yard; respected with another step forward plausible
runners.name: Lady Dora Mae
runners.spotlight: Some promise at the Curragh (1m) in sole Irish start and went very close at Lingfield (7f) for new yard; withdrawn having refused to enter the stalls in between; respected with another step forward plausible.
