runners.comment: Showed improvement with 1l second at Newcastle most recently; one of the main players
runners.name: Silky Lass
runners.spotlight: Thrice-raced filly who showed improvement with 1l second of seven at Newcastle (1m) most recently; one of the main players, provided that form is backed up.

runners.comment: Posted a duck egg in 7f maiden at Newcastle
runners.name: Spirit Of Tokyo
runners.owner: The Tokyo Bay Syndicate And P Kirby
runners.spotlight: Brings the worst form, having posted a duck egg in 7f maiden at Newcastle.

runners.comment: From a family that has served her connections well; remains open to improvement
runners.name: Vizija
runners.spotlight: Similar form in races at Kempton (fourth over 7f) and Lingfield (fifth over 1m); from a family that has served her connections well and remains open to improvement; shortlisted.

17:45.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Fillies' Handicap

runners.comment: Successful at Southwell last time and remains favourably treated on peak form
runners.name: Brazilian Rose
runners.spotlight: Successful in similar event over 7f at Southwell last time, taking AW record to 5-20; back up 4lb but remains favourably handicapped on peak form, including over 6f; respected.

runners.comment: Only midfield on reappearance but likely to do better; progressive RPRs otherwise on AW
runners.name: Diamont Katie
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Lxxiv & M Hulin
runners.spotlight: Only midfield when favourite for the Southwell contest won by Brazilian Rose but may fare better with that reappearance effort under her belt; record of 413, with progressive RPRs, otherwise on AW.

runners.comment: Gained sole win off 3lb higher in only C&D attempt; interesting back here
runners.name: Art Design
runners.spotlight: Record is only 1-13 but gained the win off 3lb higher in sole C&D attempt (for previous yard); interesting back here, assuming she takes to blinkers (replacing the cheekpieces worn last time).

runners.comment: Not solid on her AW form for new yard
runners.name: Toomuchforme
runners.spotlight: Turf success for previous stable; not solid on her form since joining new yard and switched to AW; perhaps best watched unless the market suggests a bigger run is likely.

runners.comment: Five-race maiden; good second in C&D handicap most recently; turn may be near
runners.name: Miss Mendoza
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden who has largely consistent form figures; good second, beaten only half a length, in Class 6 handicap over C&D most recently; reasonably solid and her turn may be near.

runners.comment: Return to 6f may prompt a rebound and chance is boosted by the booking of Tom Marquand
runners.name: Insuspense
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden; form dipped over 5f here most recently, ending a consistent spell; however, this return to 6f may prompt a rebound and her chance of winning is boosted by having Tom Marquand up for first time.

runners.comment: Has proved a free-going sort; may settle better and progress with hood now fitted
runners.name: Kewmill
runners.spotlight: Four-race maiden who has proved a free-going sort and had little left at the business end last time (6f); however, may settle better and show progress with hood now fitted; one to consider.

runners.comment: Creditable second last time; back up in grade but receives weight all round
runners.name: Mayo County
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-5 on turf and 1-13 on AW; met trouble over C&D on return from break and had a smoother trip when second at Newcastle (6f) later in December; back up in grade but receives weight all round.

18:15.race_name: BetMGM Supports Safer Gambling Handicap (Div I)

runners.breeder: S A S Ecurie De Cachene & Earl Haras D
runners.comment: On a workable mark; possibilities if taking well to first-time headgear
runners.name: Tennessee Gold
runners.spotlight: Three wins in 2024 but failed to add to his tally last year; however, starts his 2026 campaign on a workable mark and has possibilities if taking well to first-time headgear.

runners.comment: Respectable fourth at Chelmsford on reappearance; frame possibilities
runners.name: Commander Of Life
runners.spotlight: Successful three times last term, including at Chelmsford (7f) on final outing; respectable fourth there on reappearance; has frame possibilities off unaltered mark.

runners.comment: Runner-up twice at Southwell since returned to AW; fighting chance
runners.name: Golden Pharaoh
runners.spotlight: Gained most recent success in September and has remained in form, latterly runner-up twice at Southwell (1m) since returned to AW; fighting chance back down in trip.

runners.comment: Last-time C&D win took his Southwell record to 7-19; unexposed at this trip; respected
runners.name: Down To The Kid
runners.spotlight: Course regular who has proved consistent in the last 12 months; justified favouritism dropped back to 7f most recently, taking Southwell record to 7-19; unexposed at this trip; respected.

runners.comment: Market helpful, starting out for another new yard
runners.name: Robbo
runners.spotlight: Successful once in 2024 for Charles Hills and once in 2025 for Gary and Josh Moore; sold for 7,500gns since last run; market helpful, starting out for another new yard.

runners.comment: Useful on his day but failed to beat a rival last time
runners.name: Silver Samurai
runners.owner: What A Time To Be Alive 1
runners.spotlight: Useful on his day and is a stone below last winning mark but looks far from sure to take advantage, having failed to beat a rival in latest start; yet to score on AW.

runners.comment: Made all at Lingfield last time (second start for new yard); may remain competitive
runners.name: Giorgio M
runners.spotlight: Couple of sound performances at Lingfield since joining new yard and returning from a layoff, making all over 7f last time; may remain competitive back up just 2lb.

runners.comment: Largely consistent for current stable but has never won in this grade
runners.name: Mumayaz
runners.spotlight: Largely consistent form for current stable features a Southwell win (6f); creditable third in last two starts, the penultimate over C&D; yet to score above Class 5, however.

runners.comment: Three-time C&D winner who is on a handy mark; not ruled out
runners.name: Chola Empire
runners.spotlight: Three-time C&D winner, most recently off current mark last February; respectable second here on penultimate outing and hindered by wide trip latest; not ruled out.

18:45.race_name: BetMGM Supports Safer Gambling Handicap (Div II)

runners.comment: Hurled up 11lb for recent wins but he has less to prove than many in here
runners.name: Eligible
runners.spotlight: Thoroughly exposed 10yo but back in the groove after wins here (7f) and at Newcastle (1m); hurled up 11lb for his troubles but he has less to prove than many in here.

runners.comment: Has shown he's capable off this mark but has to rebound from two lesser efforts
runners.name: Al Muqdad
runners.spotlight: Won easily at Wolverhampton in November (7f) and was 10lb higher than that day when a close third at Newcastle the following month; now has to rebound from two lesser efforts.

runners.comment: Yet another C&D success when doing it comfortably just before Christmas; career-high mark
runners.name: King Of Ithaca
runners.spotlight: Yet another C&D success when doing it comfortably just before Christmas having raced prominently throughout; 6lb rise sees him on a career-high mark but he'll go well if in similar form.

runners.comment: Won as a 2yo; made a quiet debut for this yard at Wolverhampton a month ago
runners.name: Law Of Design
runners.spotlight: Ascot novice winner for Brian Meehan but became hard to predict for that yard and sold on for 30,000gns; made a quiet debut for this trainer at Wolverhampton a month ago when a market drifter.

runners.comment: Has been running well off this sort of mark but this is a belated return to 7f
runners.name: Hitched
runners.spotlight: Six-time AW winner who continues to run well off this sort of mark, as when beaten only a head at Wolverhampton last week (8.6f); however, this is a very belated return to 7f.

runners.comment: Well treated and all things considered ran well at Chelmsford 12 days ago
runners.name: Tolstoy
runners.spotlight: Well treated on last year's high points and it wasn't a bad run from off the pace at Chelmsford 12 days ago, given how that race panned out (pulled hard/got behind/found trouble); the cheekpieces are worth persevering with.

runners.comment: Not without hope off this mark if the break has done him good; has form here
runners.name: Feel The Need
runners.spotlight: Easy to make a case on last year's peak form but signed off with two quiet runs and now back from three months off; not without hope if the break has done him good; has form here.

runners.comment: Hasn't been that threatening since winning in a first-time tongue-tie at Chelmsford in Oct
runners.name: Sensorium
runners.owner: T Elphick M Broughton & K Shenton
runners.spotlight: Hasn't been that threatening since winning in a first-time tongue-tie at Chelmsford in October (6f); unplaced and sixth in two previous runs at 7f.
